noun.description: A spiral scroll characteristic of Ionic capitals and also used in Corinthian and composite capitals.
A deep-water marine mollusk with a thick spiral shell that is colorful and prized by collectors.

adjective.description: Forming a spiral curve or curves.
examples: spoked wheels with outside volute springs

origin: Mid 16th century: from French, or from Latin voluta, feminine past participle of volvere to roll.
